user_text: What a gorgeous waste of space!  A friend and I walked in to this cavernous venue to enjoy a little Sunday funday afternoon cocktailing.  The place is enormous and there was nobody in front to greet us.  We eventually found a hostess after standing around for a bit and we told her we were just there for cocktails.  She directed us to the cocktail section of the beautiful outdoor patio.  We sat and waited and waited.  Another table was directed to the cocktail section.  And we all waited.  After 10 minutes, I got up and asked the one of the waitresses if anyone could serve us.  She expressed annoyance with me and told me somebody would be over to help us shortly.  Then a guy walked over and told us there was no cocktail waitress on staff that day and that we could help ourselves at the bar which was all the way back by the main entrance.  So we left and I won't go back.  It was the second time (and worst time) I've had poor service there.
restaurant_type: American, (New),, Venues, &, Event, Spaces,, Cocktail, Bars

user_text: I work near here so I find myself going back every few months even though I know better.  The service is offensively horrific.  Every once in awhile someone will be halfway decent but it's very very rare.  The last time we were there (8 people for drinks and pizza), they wouldn't give us a table at first even though the restaurant was completely empty.  The waiter never even made eye contact with anyone at our table- he kept playing with his hair and rolling his eyes.  I'm not sure I've had snootier (that's putting it nicely) service anywhere else in the city.  And on top of all that, they charged us for 3 bottles of wine when we only ordered 1- I don't think it was an accident either.  Stay away, at least at night- it really is that bad.
restaurant_type: American, (New),, Venues, &, Event, Spaces,, Cocktail, Bars

user_text: I've only been here once, but overall it was impressive.  The area is very spacious and the food was really good.  I'm not a picky eater, but this place was not too bad.  I came here on a Sunday night with my friend who lives in the area, and his band of friends.  We all had a great time.  The food was a reasonable price too, and it's in the meatpacking district--you can't go wrong.
restaurant_type: American, (New),, Venues, &, Event, Spaces,, Cocktail, Bars

user_text: remember ghostbusters 2?  where the guys discover the pink sludge beneath the city that reacts to the emotions its exposed too?  well that shit would obliterate the park and everyone in it in about .2 seconds.  i would rather rim the entire d-block at attica than go to this place again.

user_text: i showed up at 2pm on a friday to see if i could get a group of 15 in during the dinner rush. the management was extremely accommodating and the service was fantastic. the waiter was dedicated solely to our table and seamlessly handled the large order, plus stragglers that came in and ordered at different times.  tip was not included for our group, allowing us to reward them for their service.  they do have a large party menu which doesn't include their delicious pizza entree.  the dinner portions are not huge, but the quality and taste of the food as well as the service, makes up for it.  everyone sat comfortably with plenty of room, and they did not rush us out even though they probably could have fit more patrons at that hour.  can't wait to go back!
restaurant_type: American, (New),, Venues, &, Event, Spaces,, Cocktail, Bars

user_text: this place is huge.  multi-level, multi-room and the deejay plays in front of an illuminated fish tank!  the bar is pretty sizeable and my friends didn't have to fight too long to get drinks.  i also liked that there were seats open for us to sit down (heels were killing me!).  if it had been warmer outside, i probably would've been open to sitting/standing in the outdoor area (after awhile they turned on heat lamps) but because there's an outdoor-type spot, i kept getting caught in wafts of cigarette smoke.  blech.there's no cover which is great, but i was trying to figure out why the venue attracted soo many asians?  i'm korean myself but this was a bit of a mystery to me.  one of my (also korean) friends pointed out that the decor was very asian-inspired, chinese, japanese, you name it.  maybe it makes people feel at home.  *shrug*.  i agree with josephine z - wish the guys were a bit more outgoing and would approach us ladies!they're not as exclusive as some of the 27th street clubs, but they do have a dress code so don't show up wearing a t-shirt and flip-flops - they will turn you away.  overall, it wasn't bad - i'd go back sometime but i wouldn't rave about it to my friends.
restaurant_type: American, (New),, Venues, &, Event, Spaces,, Cocktail, Bars
